<!-- ### Academics -->

On exam, Mr. Smalls demonstrated significant limitations in his
reading abilities.
Specifically, his proficiency in sight vocabulary fluency was
classified as Below Average.
Synthesizing both word-level and text-level reading skills fell within the Below Average range.
Mr. Smalls's ability to read and decode lists of both regular and irregular
words was also characterized as Below Average (lower than 98% of his peers).
Mr. Smalls's reading comprehension skills, encompassing word, sentence, and
passage levels, were similarly categorized as Below Average.
A composite reading index, focusing on decontextualized phonic decoding and word
reading skills, was evaluated as Below Average.
A clinically sensitive composite score, designed to identify the risk of
dyslexia among young adults, also evaluated as Below Average.
